{{Discrimination sidebar}} '''Blood libels''' are false and sensationalized allegations that a person or group engages in [[human sacrifice]], often accompanied by the claim that the [[blood]] of the victims is used in various [[ritual]]s and/or acts of [[cannibalism]]. The alleged victims are often [[child sacrifice|children]]. Some of the best documented cases of blood libel focus upon accusations against [[Jew]]s, but many other groups have been accused throughout history, including [[Christianity|Christians]], [[Cathar]]s, [[Carthage|Carthaginian]]s, [[Knights Templar]], [[witches]], [[Wicca]]ns, Christian [[Christian heresy|heretics]], [[Romani people]], [[Mormons]], [[neopagan]]s, [[Indigenous peoples of the Americas|Native Americans]], Africans, [[atheists]] and [[Communism|communists]]. {{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} ==Against Jews== [[Image:Antisemitic-church-fresco.jpg|thumb|left|200px|[[Fresco]] in St Paul's Church in [[Sandomierz]], Poland, depicting blood libel]] {{Main|Blood libel against Jews}} The first recorded instance of a blood libel against the Jews was in the writings of [[Apion]], who claimed that certain Jews sacrificed Greek victims in the [[Temple of Jerusalem]]. After this, there are no known records of the blood libel brought against Jews until the 12th century legend surrounding [[William of Norwich]], first recorded in the [[Peterborough Chronicle]]. The accusation became more common afterward . In some subsequent cases, antisemitic blood libels served as the basis for a ''blood libel cult'', in which the alleged victim of human sacrifice was venerated as a Christian martyr. Many Jews have been killed as a result of blood libels, which continue up to the present day, with the [[Menahem Mendel Beilis|Beilis Trial]] in Russia and the [[Kielce pogrom]] in post-[[World War II]] Poland. Probably the most recent high profile claim is that from December 1984, when the [[Saudi Arabian]] delegate and President of the [[World Muslim Congress]] Dr. Ma'ruf al-Dawalibi, speaking before the UN [[Human Rights Commission]] conference on religious tolerance, stated
Jews have indeed been the victims of discriminations throughout the centuries. But why? Let them answer this question themselves. The [[Talmud]] says that any Jew who does not drink every year the blood of a non-Jew will be damned forever.[http://books.google.com/books?id=i8gdMNJmpvUC&pg=PA170&dq=%22raphael+israeli%22+dawalibi&ei=FeorSpWSIYPuzQSp87CmBw Israeli, p. 170][http://books.google.com/books?id=PoqeaUWscB0C&pg=PA326&dq=%22dan+cohn-sherbok%22+dawalibi&ei=6OkrSrj0EojCyQTC9cSXBw Cohn-Sherbok, p. 326]
A thorough exploration of these various claims was carried out by a group of scholars and distinguished Jewish converts to [[Christianity]] from all parts of Europe convened by German emperor, [[Frederick II, Holy Roman Emperor|Frederick II]] which replied to the claims by stating:
Neither the Old nor the New Testament states that the Jews lust for human blood: on the contrary, it is expressly stated in the [[Bible]], in the [[laws of Moses]], and in the Jewish ordinances designated in Hebrew as the '[[Talmud]],' that they should not defile themselves with blood.[http://www.jewishencyclopedia.com/view.jsp?artid=1173&letter=B&search=TALMUD%20blood Blood Accusations by Richard Gottheil]
==Against Christians== During the first and second centuries, some [[Roman Empire|Roman]] commentators had various interpretations of the ritual of the [[Eucharist]] and related teachings. {{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} While celebrating the Eucharist, Christians drink red wine in response to the words "This is the blood of Christ". [[Propaganda]] arguing that the Christians literally drank blood based on their belief in [[transubstantiation]] was written and used to [[persecution of Christians|persecute Christians]]{{Citation needed|date=November 2008}}. The Romans were highly suspicious of Christian [[adoption]]s of abandoned Roman babies and this was suggested as a possible source of the blood.{{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} In the [[Mandaeanism|Mandaean]] scripture, the [[Ginza Rba]], a supposed Christian group called the "Minunei" are accused of a blood libel against Jewish children: "They kill a Jewish child, they take his blood, they cook it in bread and they proffer it to them as food."Ginza Rba 9.1 ==Blood libels in the modern world== Accusations of ritual murder have gradually disappeared from mainstream Christianity, and some child [[martyr]]s have been removed from the official Catholic [[calendar of saints]]. In the modern world, only radical groups and individuals advance accusations of ritual murder and blood libels. One claim states that physicians in the [[People's Republic of China]] who perform abortions consider the fetus a delicacy and eat it.{{cite web |title=Fetus Feast |publisher=[[Snopes|Snopes.com]] |url=http://www.snopes.com/horrors/cannibal/fetus.asp |date=2007-02-03 |accessdate=2007-10-20 }} The story, reported from [[Hong Kong]] by [[Bruce Gilley]], was investigated by Senator [[Jesse Helms]], and gruesome artwork reminiscent of traditional depictions of blood libel was featured in several [[pro-life]] campaigns.[http://www.jesus21.com/poppydixon/sex/chinese_eating_fetuses.html Chinese Eating Fetuses: Christian Pornography] The only use for "human fetal tissue" is in the medical research field, particularly [[stem cell research]].{{cite web |url=http://www1.od.nih.gov/oir/sourcebook/oversight/human-tissue-use.htm |title=Human-tissue-use |date=2000-09-20 |publisher=Office of Human Subjects Research, United States National Institute of Health |accessdate=2007-10-20 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.nesu.mphy.lu.se/nectar/eth.1.html |title=ETHICAL GUIDELINES FOR THE USE OF HUMAN EMBRYONIC OR FETAL TISSUE FOR EXPERIMENTAL AND CLINICAL NEUROTRANSPLANTATION AND RESEARCH |publisher=Network of European CNS Transplantation and Restoration |date=1996-02-21 |accessdate=2007-10-20 }} [[Image:GoyaBrownComparison.png|left|300px|thumb|Comparison of Brown's cartoon (right) and Goya's painting (left).]] Many Jewish groups were shocked in 2003 by the British newspaper ''[[The Independent]]'''s publication of a cartoon depicting Ariel Sharon eating a baby.{{cite web |url=http://www.somethingjewish.co.uk/articles/627__grotesque__cartoon_.htm |title="Grotesque" cartoon award |first=Leslie |last=Bunder |publisher=Something Jewish |accessdate=2007-10-20 }} The Israeli government complained to the [[Press Complaints Commission]] that the cartoon alluded to the blood libel of Jews eating the children of Christians; [[Dave Brown (UK cartoonist)|Dave Brown]], the author, responded by saying that the cartoon was in fact inspired by [[Francisco de Goya]]'s painting ''[[Saturn Devouring His Son]]'' and was not anti-Semitic in intent. The PCC accepted Brown's argument, stating "There is nothing inherently anti-semitic about the Goya image or about the myth of Saturn devouring his children, which has been used previously to satirise other politicians accused of sacrificing their own 'children' for political purposes".{{cite news |title=Independent cartoon cleared of anti-semitism |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/israel/Story/0,2763,961357,00.html |publisher=[[Guardian Unlimited]] |first=Ciar |last=Bryne |date=2003-05-22 |accessdate=2007-10-20 }} The cartoon ultimately earned Brown the British [[Political Cartoon Society]]'s Political Cartoon of the Year award. Italian Prime Minister [[Silvio Berlusconi]], during his March 2006 failed bid for re-election, said that communists had a history of boiling babies.{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/world/berlusconis-communist-claims/2006/03/27/1143330959861.html |title=Berlusconi's communist claims |publisher=[[Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=2006-03-27 |accessdate=2007-10-20 }} "I have been accused many times of saying that communists eat babies," said Berlusconi at a rally of his ''[[Forza Italia]]'' party. "Go and read the [[The Black Book of Communism|Black Book on Communism]] and you'll find that in Mao's China they didn't eat babies but they boiled them to fertilise the fields." Despite Berlusconi's 2006 denial that he has ever said that 'communists eat babies,' in the 2001 campaign, Berlusconi said "I can organise a conference in which I will prove that communists have really eaten babies and done even worse things." In July 2007, American [[Michael Yon]] reported that Lieutenant [[David Wallach]], an Arabic translator, had told him about an Iraqi official's allegations that [[Al-Qaeda in Iraq]] has baked a young boy and served the boy's body to his family.{{cite web |url=http://www.michaelyon-online.com/wp/baqubah-update-05-july-2007.htm |publisher=[[Michael Yon]] |title=Baqubah Update: 05 July 2007 |date=2007-07-05 |accessdate=2007-10-20 }} These claims were later repeated in articles by the conservative American website ''[[World Net Daily]]''.{{cite web |publisher=[[World Net Daily]] |url=http://www.worldnetdaily.com/news/article.asp?ARTICLE_ID=56723 |title=More cases of terrorists 'baking' children cited |date=2007-07-19 |accessdate=2007-10-20 |first=Bob |last=Unruh}}{{cite web |url=http://www.wnd.com/news/article.asp?ARTICLE_ID=56643 |title=Report: Al-Qaida bakes little boys |publisher=[[World Net Daily]] |date=2007-07-13 |accessdate=2007-10-20 }} Antisemitic accusations of ritual murder can still be found in [[Islamism|Islamist]] propaganda and in state-sponsored media published in a number of Muslim nations.Examples of these antisemitic accusations in the modern Muslim world include: *In 1986, Defense Minister of [[Syria]] [[Mustafa Tlass]] authored the book ''The Matzah Of Zion''.
